basic.floral_language:
Mimosa pudica 
Floriography: shy, restrained, polite 
Mimosa is pure and fresh and lovely. It is named as shy grass because the leaves will be closed by external touch. 
Shy grass is green color. Leaves are lobular arrangement. Usually four lobules are palmy arrangement and look like a small palm, very lively. With the hand touch or water, petioles prolapse, lobular are closed. After the summer it will flower. Flower is white or pink velvet ball, charming and lovely. 
Mimosa like the sunshine, but avoid direct light. Flowering from September to October, with ornamental period of 3 to 7 days.
basic.blooming: Flowering period September-October, viewing period 3-7 days
basic.color: Leaf color tender green, flower color white or pink

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate sunlight, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.watering: Likes wet environments, water thoroughly when soil is dry, may spray water on the leaves in summer, water less frequently in winter
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions,  apply once every 1-2 months in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove old, diseased, dead leaves and withered flowers timely
